relevant_findings.distress: Mild to moderate distress from fever, nausea, malaise, myalgia, and chills
relevant_findings.left_thumb_wound: Visible but had neither erythema nor swelling

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Fever declined to a maximum of 38.5°C on day 2; severe symptoms continued but had progressive resolution from days 3 to 5.

relevant_findings.chest_pain: Mild pleuritic chest pain occurred on day 4; chest radiograph was normal

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Sinus bradycardia (56 beats/min) noted, with this being described as preexisting.

relevant_findings.asymptomatic: By day 7, patient was completely asymptomatic.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Recovery noted, with no further symptoms post-day 7.
